[[Adam McKay]] (brother-in-law) }} '''Jeremy Samuel Piven''' (born July 26, 1965) is an American actor, comedian, and producer. He is known for his role as [[Ari Gold (Entourage)|Ari Gold]] in the comedy series ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]'', for which he won a [[Golden Globe Award]] and three consecutive [[Emmy Award]]s.{{Cite web|url=https://jeremy-piven.com/bio/|title=Bio|website=Jeremy Piven|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-17}} He also starred in the British period drama ''[[Mr Selfridge]]'', which tells the story of the man who created the luxury English department store chain [[Selfridges]], and portrayed Spence Kovak on [[Ellen DeGeneres]]'s sitcom ''[[Ellen (TV series)|Ellen]]''. == Early years == Piven was born in [[Manhattan, New York]], and raised in a [[Reconstructionist Judaism|Reconstructionist]]{{cite news|url=http://forward.com/articles/1385/actor-hugs-out-his-jewish-side/ |work=Jewish Daily Forward |title=Actor ‘Hugs Out’ His Jewish Side|author=Horn, Jordana |date= May 12, 2006}}{{cite web|url=http://blogs.forward.com/the-arty-semite/173651/jeremy-piven-on-ari-gold-and-mr-selfridge/|title=Jeremy Piven on Ari Gold and 'Mr. Selfridge'|publisher=|accessdate=28 August 2017}} [[Jewish]] family of Ukrainian-Jewish descent.{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ffkV1UVxODc |title=Jeremy Piven Gets A Body Double |website=YouTube |date=2009-04-22 |accessdate=2012-03-16}}{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/rides/2011/02/jeremy-piven-discusses-american-muscle-cars-hot-wheels-and-being-a-jewish-duddhist |title=Jeremy Piven Discusses American Muscle Cars, Hot Wheels, and Being a Jewish Buddhist |website=Complex |date=2011-02-18 |accessdate=2012-03-16}}{{cite web|url=http://star-ecentral.com/news/story.asp?file=/2006/10/17/tvnradio/15610460&sec=tvnradio |website=The Star Online eCentral|title= Jeremy’s journey | |date=2006-10-17 |accessdate=2012-03-16}} {{cite web|url=http://blogs.forward.com/the-arty-semite/173651/jeremy-piven-on-ari-gold-and-mr-selfridge/|title=Jeremy Piven on Ari Gold and 'Mr. Selfridge'|publisher=|accessdate=28 August 2017}} His parents are [[Byrne Piven]] (1929–2002) and [[Joyce Piven|Joyce Hiller Piven]] (née Goldstein), both of whom were actors and drama teachers.{{cite web|url=http://www.hbo.com/entourage/cast/actor/jeremy_piven.html |title=Jeremy Piven as Ari – Entourage |website=HBO |date= |accessdate=2012-03-16}}{{cite news| url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2002-02-21/news/0202210116_1_piven-theatre-workshop-shira-piven-memorials | work=Chicago Tribune | title=Piven, Byrne | date=2002-02-21}} His sister is director [[Shira Piven]], whom he has described as one of his first acting teachers; his brother-in-law is director [[Adam McKay]].{{cite web|url=http://blog.hulu.com/2013/04/01/interview-shira-and-jeremy-piven-discuss-their-indie-comedy-fully-loaded/ |title=Interview: Shira and Jeremy Piven Discuss Their Indie Comedy, "Fully Loaded" |website=Hulu |date=April 1, 2013 |accessdate=September 13, 2014}} He grew up in [[Evanston, Illinois]]{{cite web |title=Jeremy Piven Biography |url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/25/Jeremy-Piven.html |website=filmreference |year=2008 |accessdate=2008-10-29}} and graduated from [[Evanston Township High School]].{{cite web|url=http://evanstonnow.com/story/education/charles-bartling/2013-12-04/59875/distinguished-alums-honored-at-eths|title=Distinguished alums honored at ETHS|first=Charles|last=Bartling|date=December 4, 2013|publisher=|accessdate=August 28, 2017}} As a teenager, he attended Harand Theater Camp in [[Elkhart Lake, Wisconsin]], where he played Bernardo in ''[[West Side Story (musical)|West Side Story]]''. In Illinois, he trained at [[Piven Theatre Workshop]],{{cite web|url=http://www.piventheatre.org |title=Piven Theatre Workshop – Home |website=Piventheatre.org |date= |accessdate=2012-03-16}} founded by his parents. He also attended [[Drake University]] in [[Des Moines, Iowa]], where he departed after his sophomore year to attend [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]]. He left Tisch during his senior year to pursue his acting career{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A48350-2004Jul13.html |title=Jeremy Piven, Employing His Acting Skills |work=Washington Post|date=2004-07-14 |accessdate=2012-03-16}} and is an alumnus of the [[Pi Kappa Alpha]] fraternity.{{cite web|url=http://www.iastatepikes.com/id18.html |title=List of famous PIKES |website=Iastatepikes.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425083400/http://www.iastatepikes.com/id18.html |archivedate=2012-04-25 |df= }} He spent a semester at the [[Eugene O'Neill Theater Center#National Theater Institute|National Theater Institute]] at the [[Eugene O'Neill Theater Center]] in [[Waterford, Connecticut]]. He has appeared in a number of films with [[John Cusack]], who is also from Evanston and is a fellow alumnus of the Piven Theatre Workshop (as are Cusack's sisters [[Joan Cusack|Joan]] and [[Ann Cusack|Ann]]). Piven and Cusack once shared an apartment and have been friends since high school.{{cn|date=March 2018}} == Career == One of Piven's early roles was Spike in ''[[Lucas (film)|Lucas]]'' (1986). Piven's first important role came in 1992 when he became a regular cast member on HBO's ''[[The Larry Sanders Show]],'' in which he played the head writer Jerry. He left the show in the second season after growing tired of playing Jerry, because his character was not given much of a background. In 1993, he portrayed [[George Costanza]] on the [[show-within-a-show]] scene in the ''[[Seinfeld]]'' episode, "[[The Pilot (Seinfeld)|The Pilot]]". Piven was a supporting cast member on the last three seasons of the sitcom ''[[Ellen (TV series)|Ellen]]'', wherein he played the part of Ellen's cousin, Spence. He was also the star and producer of the short-lived ABC dramedy series ''[[Cupid (1998 TV series)|Cupid]]'' and voiced [[Elongated Man]] in three episodes of ''[[Justice League Unlimited]]''. Beginning in 2004, Piven achieved significant success playing the fast-talking, acerbic Hollywood agent [[Ari Gold (Entourage)|Ari Gold]] in the HBO series ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]''. He received [[Emmy]]{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.com/celebrities/jeremy-piven |title=Jeremy Piven Emmy Nominated |website=Emmys.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-16}} nominations for Best Supporting Actor four straight years, from 2005 to 2008, and win the award in 2006, 2007, and 2008; 2009 was the first year in which he did not receive an Emmy Award nomination for his work on the show. He also received [[Golden Globe]] nominations from 2005 to 2010 for the role, and win in 2008. Piven has appeared in numerous successful films, including ''[[Grosse Pointe Blank]]'', ''[[Singles (1992 film)|Singles]]'', ''[[Very Bad Things]]'', ''[[The Family Man]]'', ''[[Black Hawk Down (film)|Black Hawk Down]]'', ''[[The Kingdom (film)|The Kingdom]]'', ''[[Heat (1995 film)|Heat]]'', ''[[PCU (film)|PCU]]'', ''[[Old School (film)|Old School]]'', ''[[Rock N Rolla]]'', ''[[Serendipity]]'', ''[[Smokin' Aces]]'', and ''[[Runaway Jury]]''. He has also made cameo appearances in ''[[Rush Hour 2]]'' and the U.S. release of ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]''. In 2007, Piven appeared in the video for "Drivin' Me Wild", the third single from the rapper [[Common (rapper)|Common]]'s seventh album, ''[[Finding Forever]]''. The two were co-stars in ''[[Smokin' Aces]]'' and appeared together when Piven hosted ''SNL'' in January 2007.[http://snlarc.jt.org/ep.php?i=200701208 SNL Archives | Episode] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011201413/http://snlarc.jt.org/ep.php?i=200701208 |date=2007-10-11 }}. Retrieved October 10, 2007. Piven appeared in the first Broadway revival of [[David Mamet]]'s ''[[Speed-the-Plow]]''. The production began preview performances on October 3, 2008 and opened on October 23, 2008; the play was due to run through February 22, 2009. After Piven missed several performances, on December 17, 2008, Piven's representation announced that due to an undisclosed illness, Piven would be ending his run in the play effective immediately.[http://www.tmz.com/2008/12/17/docs-to-piven-broadway-is-bad-for-your-health/ Docs Tell Piven: Broadway is Bad for Your Health] TMZ, December 17, 2008 The illness was revealed to be [[Mercury poisoning|hydrargaria]], a disease caused by exposure to [[Mercury (element)|mercury]] or its compounds, though the source is unknown. Rumours have indicated that the high level of mercury could potentially have been caused by Piven's habit of consuming fish twice a day for the past 20 years.{{youtube|nZpm-OOYG3A|NFI Response to Jeremy's Piven's Claims About Fish and Mercury}} An alternative explanation is that the herbal remedies Piven was taking were responsible for his high levels of mercury.{{cite web|url=http://jdc325.wordpress.com/2008/12/19/fishy-poisoning-story/ |title=Discussion of the possible cause of poisoning |publisher=Jdc325.wordpress.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-16}} Mamet joked that Piven was leaving the play "to pursue a career as a thermometer."[http://www.playbill.com/news/article/124437.html Jeremy Piven Abruptly Departs Broadway's Speed-the-Plow] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081220083042/http://www.playbill.com/news/article/124437.html |date=2008-12-20 }} Playbill, December 17, 2008 On September 1, 2009, Piven, in a guest appearance on the ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'', explained that he had given up red meat and poultry, and had been getting all of his protein from fish for the past 20 years. [{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20247585,00.html|title=Jeremy Piven Abruptly Abandons Broadway Play|last=Silverman|first=Stephen M. |date=2008-12-18|work=People}} On August 3, 2009, Piven guest hosted the ''[[WWE Raw]]'' wrestling program.{{cn|date=May 2018}} In August 2011, Piven stated he was interested in portraying the drummer from [[the Who]], [[Keith Moon]].{{cite web|url=http://keithmoonmovie.com/jeremy-piven-as-keith-moon/ |title=Jeremy Piven wants to play Keith Moon? |website=Keithmoonmovie.com |date=2011-08-15 |accessdate=2012-03-16}} From 2013 to 2016, he played the [[Harry Gordon Selfridge|title role]] in the British television drama series ''[[Mr Selfridge]]'', the semi-fictional story based on the life of Harry Selfridge, who founded the London department store Selfridge's. The show aired on the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] network in the United Kingdom and [[PBS]] in the United States. == Personal life == Piven starred in the [[Travel Channel]] special, ''Jeremy Piven's Journey of a Lifetime'', detailing his journey across India. He resides in [[Malibu, California]].{{cite web|url=http://blog.hulu.com/2013/04/01/interview-shira-and-jeremy-piven-discuss-their-indie-comedy-fully-loaded/ |title=Interview: Shira and Jeremy Piven Discuss Their Indie Comedy, "Fully Loaded" |website=Hulu |date=April 1, 2013 |accessdate=September 13, 2014}} In 2016, Piven endorsed Senator [[Bernie Sanders]] for [[President of the United States]] during the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://berniesanders.com/artists/|title=Artists For Bernie|publisher=Bernie Sanders.com|accessdate=April 5, 2018}} Piven is a fan of the [[Chicago Bears]].{{cite news|title=Jeremy Piven juggles movie premiere, watching Bears|work=ESPN|url=http://espn.go.com/espn/page2/index?id=7204778 |accessdate=February 15, 2011}} In 1998, he appeared in commercials for the [[Chicago Blackhawks]]. ==Sexual misconduct allegations== On October 30, 2017, actress Ariane Bellamar accused Piven of several instances of sexual harassment and assault.{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/news/jeremy-piven-sexual-harassment-entourage-1202603537/ |title=Jeremy Piven ‘Unequivocally’ Denies Groping Allegations |first=Erin |last=Nyren|date=October 31, 2017 |work=Variety |access-date=January 29, 2018}} The next day, Piven responded to these allegations writing, "I unequivocally deny the appalling allegations being peddled about me. It did not happen".{{cite news |last1=Messer |first1=Lesley |last2=Chervokas |first2=Jason |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/jeremy-piven-unequivocally-denies-appalling-groping-allegations/story?id=50850242 |title=Jeremy Piven 'unequivocally' denies 'appalling' groping allegations |date=November 1, 2017 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=November 1, 2017}} [[Cassidy Freeman]] came to Bellamar's defense in an [[Instagram]] post, alluding to her own troubling past with Piven, who the actress claims engaged in "predatory behavior" toward her when she was "far too young".{{cite news |last1=Delbyck |first1=Cole |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/smallville-actress-cassidy-freeman-slams-jeremy-piven-for-predatory-behavior_us_59fb1c73e4b01b474048a2ac |title=‘Smallville’ Actress Cassidy Freeman Calls Out Jeremy Piven’s ‘Predatory Behavior’|date=November 2, 2017 |work=Huffington Post |accessdate=November 2, 2017}} On November 9, advertising executive Tiffany Bacon Scourby alleged that Piven had attacked her in 2003, stating that he had "jumped on" her, "exposed his genitals, held her hands down and began rubbing against her body until he ejaculated".{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2017/11/jeremy-piven-sexual-assault-tiffany-bacon-scourby-1202204960/ |title=Jeremy Piven Says Sexual Harassment Allegations Against Him 'Are Absolutely False & Completely Fabricated'|first=Greg|last=Evans|date=November 10, 2017 |website=Deadline |access-date=January 29, 2018}} Piven responded to the allegations, calling them "absolutely false and completely fabricated". A representative for Piven said the actor was "looking at legal options".{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/jeremy-piven-instagram-sexual-allegations-response-denial-a8048511.html |title=Jeremy Piven on Hollywood sex scandal: 'Careers are being destroyed based on mere allegations'|date=November 10, 2017|work=The Independent|access-date=January 29, 2018}} On November 13, Piven voluntarily took a [[polygraph test]] in which he was asked a series of questions about each allegation, which allegations he again denied. He passed the test with "no signs of deception". The polygraph test was administered by a member of the American Polygraph Association.{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/jeremy-piven-groping-allegations-lie-detector-test-arianne-bellamar-entourage-a8066891.html |title=Jeremy Piven has taken a lie detector test after sexual misconduct allegations|date=2017-11-21|work=The Independent |access-date=2017-11-22|language=en-GB}}{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/11/jeremy-piven-sexual-assault-allegations-anastasia-taneie-entourage-1202214231/#comments |title=‘Entourage’ Extra Alleges Jeremy Piven Sexually Assaulted Her In 2009 – Report |first=Nancy |last=Tartaglione |date=November 23, 2017 |website=Deadline|access-date=January 29, 2018}} Later that month, Anastasia Taneie, who worked as an extra on ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]'', alleged that Piven "confronted her in a dark hallway and groped her breast and genitals as he forcefully pushed her against a wall".{{cite news|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/fourth-woman-accuses-jeremy-piven-of-sexual-misconduct-2017-11|title=Another woman has accused Jeremy Piven of sexual misconduct on the set of HBO's 'Entourage'|work=Business Insider |access-date=January 29, 2018}} On November 27, 2017, CBS decided not to order a full season of ''[[Wisdom of the Crowd]]'', following weak ratings and allegations of sexual harassment involving Piven.{{cite web |url=http://tvline.com/2017/11/27/wisdom-of-the-crowd-cancelled-cbs-jeremy-piven-sexual-assault-allegations/ |title=Wisdom of the Crowd Cancelled Amid Jeremy Piven Sexual Assault Scandal |last=Schwartz|first=Ryan |work=[[TVLine]]|date=November 27, 2017|accessdate=December 12, 2017}} In January 2018, [[BuzzFeed]] published an article in which three more women accused Piven of "sexual misconduct or inappropriate behavior". They alleged Piven pinned down one woman on a couch after following her to her trailer on the set of a film in 1985, engaged in "physically aggressive" behavior with another while on a date, and attempted to force himself on the third woman in a hotel room around 1994. BuzzFeed News corroborated the stories with eight people who said the women had shared the encounters with them in the years since. Piven "vehemently denied" all the allegations, and his lawyer called them "works of fiction", saying they were opportunistic efforts to "obtain attention and/or money". Piven submitted a written statement to BuzzFeed, in which he referred to the lie detector test he had taken and asserted: "I have never forced myself on anyone, nor have I ever exposed myself or restrained anyone against their will. To the contrary, if any woman ever said no, I stopped".{{cite web |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/krystieyandoli/jeremy-piven-sexual-misconduct-allegations-follow-up|title=Exclusive: Three More Women Are Accusing Jeremy Piven Of Sexual Misconduct |website=Buzzfeed|access-date=January 29, 2018}}{{cite news |url=http://time.com/5122036/jeremy-piven-allegations/ |title=Jeremy Piven Faces Sexual Misconduct Allegations From 3 More Women |work=Time |access-date=January 29, 2018}} == Filmography == === Film === {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
